TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HttpResponseWrapper extends System.Web.HttpResponseBase

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that provides HTTP-response information from an ASP.NET operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpResponseWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpResponseBase> class and serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpResponse> class. This class exposes the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.HttpResponse> class while also exposing the <xref:System.Web.HttpResponseBase> type. The <xref:System.Web.HttpResponseBase> class enables you to replace the original implementation of the <xref:System.Web.HttpResponse> class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.

The response state.
Docs.summary: Sends the currently buffered response to the client.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the underlying <xref:System.Web.HttpWorkerRequest> object supports asynchronous flush operations and this method is called from an asynchronous module event or from an asynchronous handler, the flush operation is performed asynchronously. Otherwise, the flush operation is performed synchronously. Asynchronous flush is supported for IIS 6.0 and later.

Docs.exception: The response is already completed.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void PushPromise (string path);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void PushPromise(string path) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub PushPromise (path As String)
public: override void PushPromise(System::String ^ path);
override this.PushPromise : string -> unit

Docs.param: The URL of the push request. It should be the virtual path of the relative resource that the server wants to push to the client.
Docs.summary: This API is to support applications sending push promises to HTTP 2.0 clients. You can find more details regarding to Http2 server push at HTTP/2 Specification Section 8.2: Server Push.

remarks.format: ## Remarks PushPromise is non-deterministic and applications shouldn't have logic that depends on it. Its only purpose is performance advantage in some cases. There are many conditions (protocol and implementation) that may cause to ignore the push requests completely. The expectation is based on fire-and-forget.

remarks.format: ## Remarks PushPromise is non-deterministic and applications shouldn't have logic that depends on it. Its only purpose is performance advantage in some cases. There are many conditions (protocol and implementation) that may cause to ignore the push requests completely. The expectation is based on fire-and-forget.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void RedirectPermanent (string url);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void RedirectPermanent(string url) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub RedirectPermanent (url As String)
public: override void RedirectPermanent(System::String ^ url);
override this.RedirectPermanent : string -> unit

Docs.param: The URL to redirect the request to.
Docs.summary: Performs a permanent redirect from the requested URL to the specified URL.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpResponseWrapper.RedirectPermanent%28System.String%29> method overload provides a 301 HTTP status code in the response and also includes the URL to redirect the request to. A 301 HTTP status code is a standard code in an HTTP response. It indicates that a permanent redirect exists, and it provides the redirect location.
Calling the <xref:System.Web.HttpResponseWrapper.RedirectPermanent%28System.String%29> method terminates the rest of the response.

Docs.exception: is .
includes a newline character (\n).

MemberSignature.Value: public override void RedirectPermanent (string url, bool endResponse);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void RedirectPermanent(string url, bool endResponse) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub RedirectPermanent (url As String, endResponse As Boolean)
public: override void RedirectPermanent(System::String ^ url, bool endResponse);
override this.RedirectPermanent : string * bool -> unit

Docs.param: The URL to redirect the request to.
to terminate the response; otherwise . The default is .
Docs.summary: Performs a permanent redirect from the requested URL to the specified URL, and provides the option to complete the response.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpResponseWrapper.RedirectPermanent%28System.String%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method overload provides a 301 HTTP status code in the response and also includes the URL to redirect the request to. This method overload provides the option to specify whether to terminate the response or to complete it after the redirect has been performed. A 301 HTTP status code is a standard code in an HTTP response. It indicates that a permanent redirect exists, and it provides the redirect location.

Docs.exception: is .
includes a newline character (\n).

Docs.summary: Redirects a request to a new URL by using the specified route parameter values, a route name, or both.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void RedirectToRoute (object routeValues);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void RedirectToRoute(object routeValues) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub RedirectToRoute (routeValues As Object)
public: override void RedirectToRoute(System::Object ^ routeValues);
override this.RedirectToRoute : obj -> unit

Docs.param: The route parameter values.
Docs.summary: Redirects a request to a new URL by using the specified route parameter values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is provided for coding convenience. It is equivalent to calling the <xref:System.Web.HttpResponseWrapper.Redirect%28System.String%2CSystem.Boolean%29> method with the second parameter set to `false`.
This method converts the object that is passed in `routeValues` to a <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary?displayProperty=nameWithType> object by using the <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteValueDictionary.%23ctor%28System.Object%29?displayProperty=nameWithType> constructor. The <xref:System.Web.Routing.RouteCollection.GetVirtualPath%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method is then called to determine the URL.
ASP.NET performs the redirection by returning a 302 HTTP status code.

Docs.exception: No route corresponds to the specified route parameters.
Redirection was attempted after the HTTP headers had been sent.

ASP.NET performs the redirection by returning a 302 HTTP status code.

Redirection was attempted after the HTTP headers had been sent.

The provider that is used to remove the output-cache artifacts that are associated with the specified path.
Docs.summary: Uses the specified output-cache provider to remove all output-cache artifacts that are associated with the specified path.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Call this method to remove output-cache items that are associated with the custom output-cache providers that are specified in the Web site configuration file. To remove output-cache items that are associated with the default output-cache provider, call the <xref:System.Web.HttpResponseWrapper.RemoveOutputCacheItem%28System.String%29> method overload.

Docs.exception: is .
is an invalid path.

Docs.summary: Sets the value that is returned to the client.
Docs.value: The status of the HTTP output. The default value is "200 (OK)". For information about valid status codes, see [HTTP Status Codes](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=73157) on the MSDN Web site.
Docs.exception: is set to an invalid status code.

Docs.exception: was set after the HTTP headers were sent.
